metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6458 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
Multiple buffer overflows in the ctl_put* functions in NTP before 4.2.8p10 and 4.3.x before 4.3.94 allow remote authenticated users to have unspecified impact via a long variable.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6458` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu1
ntpdate - 1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu1
sntp - 1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This is not a vulnerability per se, but a weakness in an internal helper function

criterions.comment: ntp package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu1').
